newsitem.title: CANADA: BASEBALL-TORONTO'S GUZMAN BREAKS HIS THUMB.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-TORONTO'S GUZMAN BREAKS HIS THUMB.

text.p: Toronto Blue Jays pitcher Juan Guzman, who led the American League in ERA last season, broke his right thumb in Wednesday night's 6-4 loss to the New York Yankees and was placed on the 15-day disabled list Thursday.

Guzman, who has battled shoulder stiffness and bouts of ineffectiveness en route to a 3-5 record this season, took a grounder by Bernie Williams off the thumb in the seventh inning but made the play to retire the side.

The right-hander did not return for the eighth and was diagnosed with a fracture of the thumb with a slight displacement and dislocation. He is out indefinitely, but is slated to see a specialist on Monday to determine his recovery period.
The 30-year-old Guzman has an ERA of 4.87 this season after going 11-8 with a 2.93 ERA in 27 starts with four complete games and 165 strikeouts in 187 2/3 innings in 1996.
